author: Chief Chapree
title: Digi Aims To Help Hotels Deliver Connectivity For Their Guests Through Handy Smartphones
text:
Pinterest 
In several cities throughout the world, there are hotels that provide guest with smartphone complete with free local calls and unlimited data to be used throughout their stay. Through a recent partnership with Hong Kong-based Tink Labs Limited , Digi are now looking into helping hoteliers in Malaysia to deliver the same value-added service for their guests. 
Tink Labs is known for its customized version of Android called handy which is designed for the hospitality industry from ground-up. In general, the custom OS allows hotels to add additional services into the handy-powered smartphones such as notifications, internal push messaging, and local city guides while guests can still use those phones for calling, Internet browsing, and social media just like a normal smartphone. 
In fact, hoteliers can also choose to allow guests access their concierge or even order room service remotely through handy-powered smartphone. Additionally, they can also be set as keyless door access, and in-room entertainment remote control. 
Through this partnership, Digi not only enables handy devices to run on its 4G+ network but also becomes the sole distributor of handy solution in Malaysia. In a way, this is quite a new venture for Digi but if it plays the card right, handy smartphones could be a common value added service for hotels throughout the country.
